ca.mcgill.ecse211.dpmfinalprojectteam3

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.dpmfinalprojectteam3.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Navigates the robot around using coordinates that get converted into distances based on the length of the tiles. Other features include methods for specific tasks such as avoiding an obstacle and searching for the flag.
    Version:
    1.0

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double endX,
                     double endY)
        Travel to, orients the robot to x and y on the grid calls turn to if the robot is not aligned in the proper position to reach x and y. If using start nav method, will continuously call this method until no more coordinates in the path
        Parameters:
        endX - x coordinate of the destination
        endY - y coordinate of the destination

        public void Avoid(double endX,

        Parameters:

        endY - the end Y

        public void turnWithSameSpeed(double theta)

        Parameters:

      • flagSearch

        public boolean flagSearch(int correctColor)
        Method called once we reach one of the search regions (lower left of red region or upper right of green region) Travels the x and y length of the search region while simultaneously searching for the correct color block. Once it travels the y or x length, it will then turn to the next corner and travel to that corner until it finds the correct color block. Once the light sensor comes across the correct block, the robot will then beep 3 times and then travel to the upper left of the green region or lower right of the red region to then figure out where it needs to go next.
        Parameters:
        correctColor - the correct color
        Returns:
        true, once it finds the correct flag, keep traversing along the search region until the robot reaches the upper left corner of the green search region or the lower right region of the search region to then continue where it has to go next
        Since:
        10/29/17

      • travelInSequence

        public void travelInSequence(double[] coords,
                             boolean whichZone)
        Travel in a continuous sequence (in a square/rectangle in this case), ending in the same spot unless interupted by flag search, then travel to upper left of green search region or lower right of red search region .
        Parameters:
        coords,coords - that will be traveled continously
        whichZone, - if in red zone or green zone have to traverse slightly different
        Since:
        10/29/17

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                  double distance)
        Convert distance.
        Parameters:
        radius - the radius of the wheels
        distance - the distance that needs to be traveled
        Returns:
        rotations, the number of rotations each wheel has to rotate in order to go that distance

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle(double radius,
                               double width,
                               double angle)
        Convert angle.
        Parameters:
        radius - the radius, wheel radius of robot
        width - the width, distance between the wheels of the robot
        angle - the angle, the angle we want the robot to turn to
        Returns:
        rotations, the number of rotations each wheel has to turn to adjust heading to theta
